creator: cristian.fogel@softvision.ro

comments.text:
Created attachment 8972517
bing-tab_index.gif

[Affected versions]:
- Firefox 60.0, Firefox 60.0b15, Firefox 61.0a1 (2018-05-01)

[Affected platforms]:
- Windows 10x64, Ubuntu 16.04x64   

[Steps to reproduce]:
1. Launch Firefox.
2. Go to https://www.bing.com/.
3. Select the [Outlook.com] link from the header section.
4. Press the TAB key 3 times.

[Expected result]:
- The active element should be the left pointing arrow from the bottom-right section of the page.

[Actual result]:
- The preferences list selection is displayed. The list is empty so you see a dashed line, 2px in height. See the attached screen-cast.
 
[Regression range]:
Not a regression, since it's reproducible on Firefox 4.0b9pre. Earlier versions do not display the website's affected section properly.

[Additional notes]:
- The issue is also reproducible if instead of steps 3+4 you press the TAB key 10 times.
- The list should be skipped since it's not displayed, as default.
- The issue is not reproducible on other browsers.
- Issue is not present on macOS 10.12.6.
comments.author: cristian.fogel@softvision.ro

comments.text:
The element is #id_hbfo, and its HTML for me is:
> <span id="id_hbfo" _iid="SERP.5068" class=" hpfo hb_hpqexp  slide_up" aria-hidden="true" aria-haspopup="true" role="menu">

It's not clear to me why this element is focusable at the first place...

Anyway, it sounds like a problem related to the focus manager, so move to DOM.
comments.author: xidorn+moz@upsuper.org

assigned_to_detail.name: nobody@mozilla.org
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

summary: Bing tab index  - selects hidden dropdown menus
